ThingDef.label: kneaderpillar
ThingDef.description:
A large, fat, worm-like invertebrate about the size of a bear. They share the movement method of a caterpillar, but not much else. Unlike caterpillars, kneaderpillars are a single-stage lifeform. Unlike most invertibrates, they also raise their own young.
They are remarkably tame around people, especially if careful and slow movements are used. A comfortable kneaderpillar becomes pliant and easy to control, which makes them decent pack animals.
Kneaderpillars produce insect jelly in order to feed their young. This can be harvested by those that the kneaderpillar feels comfortable around.
